article:
I still remember the summer when I was with my aunt at the age of seven.One day, she asked me to go to Miss Bee's store with a   _  .How could I find anything on the   _  shelves around me?
I walked up to the counter,   _  up the list, and told the lady behind it I needed those. "So? Go to get them." She    _   to a sign  on the door."There's no one here except you and me and I'm not your servant.40 _ yourself a basket and start filling." 
The store was a   _  .I searched shelf after shelf and when I finally   _   it, I was exhausted and it was already sundown.
I visited Miss Bee's,    _   with my list, twice a week that summer.Sometimes she short-charged me.Other times she overcharged   _   sold me an old newspaper instead of one that was current.Going to the store was more like going into  _  . Every time I told her that she had overcharged, she just looked at me  _  her glasses and fixed the price.The moment I remembered the location of an item.Miss Bee rearranged the shelves and made me   _  for it all over again.By summer's end the shopping trip that had   at one time   taken me an hour was done in 15 minutes.
On my last trip to the store.Miss Bee asked: "What did you  _   this summer?" That you're mean! I pressed my lips together.To my   _  , Miss Bee laughed."I know what you think of me.But I am   _   to teach every child some life lessons. When you grow up you'll be glad our paths   _  !" Glad I met Miss Bee? I thought it a stupid  _   until one day my daughter came to me with homework troubles."If I do it for you, how will you ever learn to do it yourself?" I said.Suddenly, I was back at Miss Bee's store and realized that she had really taught me   _   .Now it is my turn to share some   _   lessons as Miss Bee did years ago.
